modify.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to make small changes to something in order to improve it and make it more suitable or effective
modify.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: The feedback will be used to modify the course for next year.
The regulations can only be modified by a special committee.
The seats can be modified to fit other types of vehicle.
modify.translation[0].definitions[1].def: if an adjective, adverb etc modifies another word, it describes something or limits the word’s meaning. In the phrase ‘walk slowly’, the adverb ‘slowly’ modifies the verb ‘walk’.
modify.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to make changes, especially small changes, to something in order to improve it and make it more suitable or effective
modify.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The plan has been slightly modified.
Banks have modified their traditional role and now offer mortgages, pensions, and other financial services.
